item.title: [PI]Making Commands help.[PI]
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“unjail”)) {
if (c.inWild()) {
c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE, get out of the wild to jail-unjail!");
return;
}
if (c.InDung()) {
c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE, You can not check banks when inside Dungeoneering");
return;
}
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName
.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
if (c2.InDung()) {
c.sendMessage(“You cannot Jail/Unjail someone in Dungeoneeing.”);
}

                                                            c2.monkeyk0ed = 0;
                                                            if (c2.InDung()) {
                                                                    c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE</col>, You can not jail when inside Dungeoneering");
                                                                    return;
                                                            }
                                                            c2.Jail = false;
                                                            c2.getPA().startTeleport(3086, 3493, 0, "modern");
                                                            c2.sendMessage("You have been unjailed by "
                                                                            + c.playerName + ".");
                                                            c.sendMessage("Successfully unjailed "
                                                                            + c2.playerName + ".");
                                                    }
                                            }
                                    }
                            } catch (Exception e) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
                            }
                    } //Ends here
     
            }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making Commands help.[PI]
item.dc:creator: @iLL_Scape iLL Scape
item.description:
@iLL_Scape wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:44, topic:451410”][code=java]
if (command.equals(“acommand”)) { // opening brace
if (condition) { // opening brace

    // handle condition

} // closing brace

} // closing brace.[/code][/quote][code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“unjail”)) {
if (c.inWild()) {
c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE, get out of the wild to jail-unjail!");
return;
}
if (c.InDung()) {
c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE, You can not check banks when inside Dungeoneering");
return;
}
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName
.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
if (c2.InDung()) {
c.sendMessage(“You cannot Jail/Unjail someone in Dungeoneeing.”);
}

                                                            c2.monkeyk0ed = 0;
                                                            if (c2.InDung()) {
                                                                    c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE</col>, You can not jail when inside Dungeoneering");
                                                                    return;
                                                            }
                                                            c2.Jail = false;
                                                            c2.getPA().startTeleport(3086, 3493, 0, "modern");
                                                            c2.sendMessage("You have been unjailed by "
                                                                            + c.playerName + ".");
                                                            c.sendMessage("Successfully unjailed "
                                                                            + c2.playerName + ".");
                                                    }
                                            }
                                    }
                            } catch (Exception e) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
                            }
                    }
     
            }
     [/code]Then it goes to admin commands ok  but see how it doesnt have a { at the end? Where would the end be for this?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making Commands help.[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[code=java]
if (command.equals(“acommand”)) { // opening brace
if (condition) { // opening brace

    // handle condition

} // closing brace

} // closing brace.[/code]

item.title: [PI]Making Commands help.[PI]
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Actually, count the braces that look like this { until you see one that looks like this }
{ = +1
} = -1

Once your number equals zero, that’s the end(if that makes sense)

Edit: after an if statement

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @iLL_Scape iLL Scape
item.description:
@iLL_Scape wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:39, topic:451410”]Braces.

{ and }

under the appropriate method.

[code=java]
// Commands for everyone.
public void playerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)

// Commands for moderators +
public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)

// etc…

[/code][/quote]I got that part but wait how do i tell where the end of a command is so i can add a new one

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making Commands help.[PI]
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I’ll try to explain it(Wish me luck)

When ever you say if, even in real life, you are implying that you have to do something first before something else can happen.

For example, if you have two bananas, you have a pair of bananas.

Here is a simple little java class explaining this:

public class Bananas {//Starts off the class public static void main(String[] args) { // The main thing, usually what you use in run.bat boolean pairOfBananas = false; //This is part of the if statement int bananas = 2; // This is also part of the if statement if(bananas >= 2) { // This is saying, if you have 2 or more bananas pairOfBananas = true; //If you have 2 or more bananas, it's true } else { // If you have anything other than 2 or more bananas pairOfBananas = false;// It's false. }// End of if statement }//End of main void }//End of class

Read full topic
